job_title: Assistant Director of Partnerships and Business Development
job_description:
Position Summary: We are a premier, accredited online language school seeking an Assistant Director of Partnerships and Business Development to play a pivotal role in cultivating new partnerships and fostering growth within existing ones across various sectors, including schools/universities, professionals, and organizations. This role demands exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, alongside the ability to deliver compelling presentations. Strong organizational and project management capabilities are also essential.

Responsibilities:

Develop, Maintain, and Nurture Relationships
• Provide excellent internal and external customer service through professional, consistent, and effective communication
• Call on (in person and virtually) education and business professionals (school counselors/administrators, IECs, HR Directors, etc.) to spread awareness of the LanguageBird brand and generate referrals
• Complete 20 or more outreach meetings per month
• Develop and execute individualized nurturing plans for each relationship (ex. seasonal gifts, thank you cards for referrals, personalized invitations to events, etc.)
• Generate 30 new professional referral sources each academic year
• Grow partner and connector portfolio
• Manage partner and connector pipeline

Manage Data
• Maintain updated CRM (HubSpot) and provide sales pipeline forecast and weekly activity reports
• Track and update deals based on their sales cycle
• Input and monitor partner enrollment information in CRM
• Support Director of Admissions with organizational projects in CRM
• Import Purchase Order documents into HubSpot deals

Serve as Brand Ambassador and Elevate Brand Awareness
• Effectively communicate and promote the LanguageBird brand with all current and prospective referral sources
• Practice triangle training regularly to finesse and perfect messaging for all stakeholders
• Plan the promotion and execution of other lead-generating events and activities (webinars, conferences, etc.)
• Innovate and initiate ideas on how to generate more referrals

Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, sales, education, or equivalent work experience
• Must reside in and be eligible to work in the United States of America
• Willingness to work non-traditional hours with possible evening and weekend meetings/activities
• Knowledge of and experience with sales process, minimum 2 years
• Deep respect for teaching and learning
• Ability to self-direct and collaborate with a team working remotely
• Ability to prioritize and manage complex projects with multiple deadlines
• Ability to think critically, problem-solve, backwards plan, analyze, and use data
• Commitment to constant self-improvement and professional development
• Willingness to go above and beyond to deliver white-glove experience to students/parents
• Strong skills with Windows, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, One Note, Teams, and Outlook
• Experience with CRM systems (eg. HubSpot) preferred
• Must be able to travel by air or motor vehicle to conferences, trainings, and meetings as needed/required

Competencies (job-related): Honest, organized, follows-through on commitments, persistent, proactive, calm under pressure, strategic and critical thinker, strong listening skills, excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong presentation and meeting facilitation skills, influential, knowledgeable, entrepreneurial, and energetic

Competencies (cultural): Intelligent, creative, adaptable, continuous learner committed to self-improvement, passionate, enthusiastic, engaging, personable, positive, punctual, and confident Tips: Provide a summary of the role, what success in the position looks like, and how this role fits into the organization overall.

Qualifications: Strong organizational and project management capabilities are also essential
